agency_name: COMMUNITY ACTION PROGRAM, INC. OF WESTERN INDIANA
agency_desc: A community action agency that works collaboratively with community partners to promote economic self-sufficiency by removing the causes and conditions of poverty through services, support, and education.
site_name: COMMUNITY ACTION PROGRAM, INC. OF WESTERN INDIANA - MONTGOMERY COUNTY
service_description: Provides weatherization services for income eligible homeowners and renters at no cost to them. Services may include but are not limited to; general air sealing, insulation upgrades, heating equipment replacement, and baseload energy consumption reduction.
site_details: Call or visit the website to apply.
site_eligibility: Living in Montgomery County -- Household income at or below 200% Federal Poverty Guidelines

agency_desc: Provides electric service for customers within service area.
service_description: Provides electric service in parts of Boone, Clinton, Fountain, Montgomery, and Tippecanoe County.
site_details: Call for assistance; bill can be paid online, in person, by mail, or by phone.

site_schedule.name: Electric Service Providers
site_schedule.schedule: Office: Mon-Fri 8am-4:30pm -- Outage Reporting: Daily 24 hours through an automated system

site_eligibility: Addresses within set boundaries in Clinton, Fountain, Montgomery, and Tippecanoe County.

agency_name: COAL CREEK TOWNSHIP TRUSTEE - MONTGOMERY COUNTY
agency_desc: An elected official responsible for administering the township, including such duties as providing township assistance, burial of the indigent, and maintaining the township budget.
site_name: COAL CREEK TOWNSHIP TRUSTEE - MONTGOMERY COUNTY
service_description: May be able to assist township residents who are experiencing an unexpected crisis with basic needs, such as:  Essential utilities -- Burial/Cremation expenses -- Housing expense -- Work/Medical transportation -- Food/Clothing -- Necessary medications/medical care assistance is at the discretion of the trustee. Denials can be appealed to the county commissioner; information on appealing is included in the denial letter.
taxonomy_name: Prescription Drugs for Specific Health Conditions
nameLevel4: Prescription Drugs for Specific Health Conditions

site_schedule.name: Prescription Drugs for Specific Health Conditions

site_eligibility: MUST LIVE IN TOWNSHIP (Visit www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address to discover township.) -- With financial need based on assessment -- Able to provide documentation of income and expenses for all household members

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization offering a food, clothing, and linen pantry.
site_name: FISH OF MONTGOMERY COUNTY - ST. BERNARD'S CATHOLIC CHURCH
service_description: Provides perishable and nonperishable food to those in need. Personal grooming/toiletries may be available depending on donations. Limited service area.
site_details: Go to rear parking lot of church and enter in the Knights of Columbus building (near playground area).
site_eligibility: Living in Montgomery County -- Limit two visits per month

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization offering a food, clothing, and linen pantry.
site_name: FISH OF MONTGOMERY COUNTY - WABASH AVENUE PRESBYTERIAN CHURCH
service_description: Offers gently used clothing to those in need. Infant through adult sizes are generally available; coats and shoes may be available based on donations. Limited service area.
site_details: Walk in; Use red door located in the alley.

site_schedule.name: General Clothing Provision
site_schedule.schedule: Mon 10am-12 noon; Wed 3pm-5pm -- Monthly 3rd Sat 9am-12 noon

site_eligibility: Living in Montgomery County

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization offering a food, clothing, and linen pantry.
site_name: FISH OF MONTGOMERY COUNTY - FIRST BAPTIST CHURCH
service_description: Offers gently used towels, washcloths, sheets, blankets, and comforters to those in need. New pillows may be available depending on donations. Limited service area.
site_details: Walk in.
site_eligibility: Living in Montgomery County

agency_desc: A church offering worship services and charitable outreach programs, including a food pantry.
service_description: Provides perishable and nonperishable food to those in need. Open service area.
site_details: Drive through for service.
site_eligibility: Limit one (1) visit every two (2) weeks

agency_desc: Administers the elementary, middle, and high schools within the district.
service_description: Administers the elementary, middle, and high schools in this school district. Provides student transportation services and maintains information on school locations, enrollment, fees, and curricula. District provides information regarding special education services for students age 3-22 with disabilities.
site_details: Call for information about school assignments, transportation, or other issues. -- Contact the assigned school to enroll.
site_eligibility: Students living within the school district in grades K-12

agency_desc: Administers the elementary, middle, and high schools within the district.
service_description: Offers instruction in basic reading, math, language arts, technology, life skills, and job readiness as well as preparation for the high school equivalency test. Day and evening classes available throughout the year.
site_details: Call for orientation schedule. -- Online classes are available.
site_eligibility: Age 16 or older -- Not enrolled in high school (documentation required for ages 16-17)

Have lived in Indiana for at least 30 days -- Age 18 or older (recommended); ages 16-17 may be eligible to take the test  with a letter of recommendation signed by a superintendent of an Indiana public  school system -- Not enrolled in high school

agency_desc: Serves as the executive and administrative authority for Montgomery County.
service_description: Serves as the executive and administrative authority for Montgomery County, including performing the following duties: Controls, maintains, and supervises county property -- Audits and authorizes claims against the county -- Receives bids for and authorizes county contracts -- Performs certain election functions -- Handles appeals of township trustee decisions
site_details: Call for assistance.

site_schedule.name: General Relief Appeals/Complaints
site_schedule.schedule: Office: Mon-Fri 8am-4:30pm -- Board Meetings:  Monthly 2nd and 4th Mon 8am

site_schedule.name: Local Officials Offices
site_schedule.schedule: Office: Mon-Fri 8am-4:30pm -- Board Meetings:  Monthly 2nd and 4th Mon 8am

site_eligibility: Varies by service

agency_desc: Represents the state of Indiana in felony and misdemeanor criminal prosecutions, conducts criminal investigations, supervises Grand Jury proceedings, enforces child support orders, conducts juvenile adjudication and prosecution, enforces traffic violations, and provides information and assistance to victims of crime.
service_description: Provides advocacy, information, referrals, and support services to crime victims and witnesses in Montgomery County. Provides information about restraining orders, case status, victim compensation, victim rights, and the legal process.
site_details: Call for more information.

site_schedule.name: Child Support Petition Filing Offices
site_schedule.schedule: Mon-Fri 8:30am-4:30pm -- Indiana KidsLine (Payment Information): Recorded information daily 24 hours; live assistance Mon-Fri 7am-6pm

site_schedule.name: Child Support Assistance/Enforcement
site_schedule.schedule: Mon-Fri 8:30am-4:30pm -- Indiana KidsLine (Payment Information): Recorded information daily 24 hours; live assistance Mon-Fri 7am-6pm

site_eligibility: Victims and witnesses of major crimes in Montgomery County
Varies by service

To File for Child Support Assistance: Living in Montgomery County -- Parent, guardian, aunt, uncle, or grandparent who has physical custody of a child (ages 0-18) -- Requiring financial support from a noncustodial parent of the child

agency_desc: A faith-based organization that provides limited financial assistance to those in need living in Montgomery County.
service_description: Provides limited financial assistance for utilities, rent, or mortgage payments to those in need living in Montgomery County. Emergency assistance is determined on a case-by-case basis and availability of funds.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment.

site_schedule.name: Mortgage Payment Assistance
site_schedule.schedule: Varies; voicemail available daily 24 hours -- By appointment only

site_schedule.name: Rent Payment Assistance
site_schedule.schedule: Varies; voicemail available daily 24 hours -- By appointment only

site_schedule.name: Electric Service Payment Assistance
site_schedule.schedule: Varies; voicemail available daily 24 hours -- By appointment only

site_schedule.name: Gas Service Payment Assistance
site_schedule.schedule: Varies; voicemail available daily 24 hours -- By appointment only

site_schedule.name: Heating Fuel Payment Assistance
site_schedule.schedule: Varies; voicemail available daily 24 hours -- By appointment only

site_schedule.name: Water Service Payment Assistance
site_schedule.schedule: Varies; voicemail available daily 24 hours -- By appointment only

site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A nonprofit counseling service for individuals with problems of violence or abusive behavior. Offers an Indiana Coalition Against Domestic Violence Certified Batterers Intervention Program.
service_description: Provides a counseling service for men with problems of violent or abusive behavior, including perpetrators of domestic abuse and/or child abuse. This program is certified by the Indiana Coalition Against Domestic Violence (ICADV).
site_details: Call to schedule orientation. (Persons with a court-order must attend an orientation session to meet court requirements.)
site_eligibility: Men and women who use violence in relationships -- Age 18 or older or age 17 or younger with parent/guardian permission

agency_desc: A government organization that administers housing assistance programs.
service_description: Serves as an application and re-certification site for the Section 8 Housing Choice Voucher program. Housing Choice Vouchers help eligible households pay the rent on privately owned homes of their choosing (property owners must agree to program participation). The wait list for Housing Choice Vouchers in this area is currently OPEN. People already on the wait list must keep their contact information current to remain on the list.
site_details: Walk in to pick up an application for the wait list. -- People already on the wait list, call or walk in to update contact information as needed.
site_eligibility: Household income below set limits -- Preference given to families with children, seniors, people with disabilities, and persons who are homeless.

agency_name: ANIMAL WELFARE LEAGUE OF MONTGOMERY COUNTY
agency_desc: A nonprofit humane society providing animal shelter and adoption services.
site_name: ANIMAL WELFARE LEAGUE OF MONTGOMERY COUNTY
service_description: Provides shelter for stray and unwanted animals in the city of Crawfordsville and rehomes animals through adoption.
site_details: Call for more information. -- To view adoptable pets, visit www.mcawl.com.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A church with worship services and charitable outreach, including counseling.
service_description: Provides faith-based counseling services for youth, individuals, and families.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call or visit www.eastsidebc.com/counseling to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: Home For Friendless Animals is a not-for-profit, no-kill sanctuary providing a loving refuge for stray, abandoned, and abused dogs and cats.
service_description: Provides shelter for stray and unwanted animals in Montgomery County and rehomes animals through adoption.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment. -- Visit www.homeforfriendlessanimals.com to view available animals.
site_eligibility: Age 18 or older

agency_desc: A nonprofit agency that provides gently used or new clothing for children in Montgomery County, Indiana.
service_description: Provides gently used or new clothing, shoes, baby blankets, towels, bibs, burp rags, and crib sheets for children living in Montgomery County. Sizes available include newborn up to youth size 16.
site_details: Text or email to request assistance

site_schedule.name: Baby Clothing
site_schedule.schedule: By appt only; text or email to request assistance

site_schedule.name: Children's Clothing
site_schedule.schedule: By appt only; text or email to request assistance

site_schedule.schedule: By appt only; text or email to request assistance

site_schedule.schedule: By appt only; text or email to request assistance

site_eligibility: Living in Montgomery County -- Children wearing sizes newborn to youth 16

agency_desc: A nonprofit agency that provides gently used or new clothing for children in Montgomery County, Indiana.

service_description: Provides gently used or new, adult sized clothing and shoes for teens living in Montgomery County.
site_details: Text or email to request assistance

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides a supportive environment for those in recovery and those still struggling with addiction.
service_description: Offers a space for parents to talk about their struggles and create a support network. Free food and childcare are offered during meetings.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call to register.

site_schedule.name: Parent Support Groups
site_schedule.schedule: Office: Mon-Fri 5pm-9pm; Sat 5pm-11pm; Sun 6pm-9pm; Meetings: vary; call for details

site_schedule.name: Alcohol Use Disorder Education/Prevention
site_schedule.schedule: Office: Mon-Fri 5pm-9pm; Sat 5pm-11pm; Sun 6pm-9pm; Classes: vary; call or visit website for details

site_schedule.name: Drug Use Disorder Education/Prevention
site_schedule.schedule: Office: Mon-Fri 5pm-9pm; Sat 5pm-11pm; Sun 6pm-9pm; Classes: vary; call or visit website for details

site_eligibility: Parents
Individuals seeking support with substance use disorder

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Provides routine health and safety inspections and investigates complaints against restaurants, grocery stores, and other food service establishments in the County. Provides consultation and licensing for retail food service vendors and food safety education for individuals, health fairs, and community groups.
site_details: Call to make a complaint about licensed food service establishments in the County or for details about licensing or food safety programs.
site_eligibility: Varies by service; serves Montgomery County
Schools, community organizations, and other groups in the County

Living within Montgomery County -- Age 2 months through 18 years-old -- Without health insurance -OR- insurance does not cover needed vaccine (including coverage that has capped out) -OR- insured through Medicaid -OR- American Indian or Alaskan Native, regardless of insurance status
Living within the county
Montgomery County residents with sharps in hard plastic containers
Age 6 months or older
Births/deaths occurring in the County -- Individual named on the birth certificate, parent, or other adult with a legal right to the certificate
Varies by service; call for information.
Age 19 or older

agency_desc: The County Clerk maintains records of all civil and criminal court activities, administers jury draw, child support collections, and voter registration, issues marriage licenses and records state tax liens in Montgomery County.
service_description: Issues, provides, and maintains marriage licenses issued in the county. No witnesses, blood tests, or waiting period are required to obtain one. Both applicants must appear at the time of application. Marriages must take place within 60 days of the marriage license being issued.
taxonomy_name: Criminal Record Expungement Petition Filing Offices
nameLevel4: Criminal Record Expungement Petition Filing Offices
site_details: Walk in. Marriage license forms may be completed in advance online or in the clerk's office.

site_schedule.name: Marriage Licenses
site_schedule.schedule: Mon-Fri 8am-4:30pm -- All applications must be in by 4pm

site_schedule.name: Criminal Record Expungement Petition Filing Offices
Child Support Assistance/Enforcement
site_schedule.schedule: Mon-Fri 8am-4:30pm -- Indiana Kids Line (Payment Information): Recorded information daily 24 hours; live assistance Mon-Fri 7am-6pm

site_eligibility: Marriage license: Both parties at least age 18 (call or visit website for exceptions) -- At least one applicant from this county -OR- both from out of state -- Certified copies: License must have been issued in this county
Registering to vote: United States citizen -- Age 18 by the day of the next election -- Not currently incarcerated -- To vote: Registered to vote a minimum of 29 days before the election
Varies by service; serves Montgomery County
Parents ordered by the court to pay or receive child support

agency_desc: Provides emergency fire and medical services for the city of Crawfordsville and Union Township in Montgomery County.
service_description: Provides a smoking cessation program with individualized counseling for pregnant women. Requires four prenatal meetings during pregnancy and then monthly meetings after delivery. Clients may select a smoking support partner, who resides with them, to enroll.  Participants who remain smoke-free throughout the pregnancy and first year of the baby's birth may each qualify for a $25 diaper voucher each month, to be redeemed at participating Walmarts.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Pregnant women, with or without a smoking support partner (living in same household) -- Currently smoking or smoked at least 3 months prior to pregnancy -- Willing to quit smoking and submit to a breath/saliva test
Open; responds to emergency situations in the city of Crawfordsville and Union Township of Montgomery County

agency_desc: Serves as the state trial court for the county, hearing both civil and criminal cases.
service_description: Handles civil lawsuits for $10,000 or less, including contracts, collection of rent, evictions, and personal loans. Only corporations are required to be represented by an attorney and only on claims over $6,000. In Montgomery County, Superior Court 2 handles small claims cases.
site_details: Call for information, walk in to the County Clerk's office --visit the website for claims forms.
site_eligibility: To file a lawsuit: Age 18 or older -- With a civil claim for less than $10,000 -- Meeting one of the following three requirements: Person being sued lives or works in Montgomery County -- Matter resulting in lawsuit took place in Montgomery County -- Matter resulting in lawsuit was to be performed in Montgomery County
Persons named in cases or called for jury duty at this court

agency_desc: Serves as the state trial court for the county, hearing both civil and criminal cases.
service_description: Provides probation services for the Montgomery County Circuit and Superior Courts, including supervising juvenile and adult offenders in the community and linking them with programs and services to support their rehabilitation.
site_details: Through the courts; call for details.

site_schedule.name: Probation
site_schedule.schedule: Mon, Tues, Thurs, and Fri 8am-4:30pm; Wed 10am-6:30pm

site_eligibility: Offenders assigned to probation by the Montgomery County Courts

agency_name: WEST CENTRAL INDIANA SPECIAL SERVICES COOPERATIVE
agency_desc: A cooperative of school districts that provides centralized special education services to students living within the boundaries of the participating school districts.
site_name: WEST CENTRAL INDIANA SPECIAL SERVICES COOPERATIVE
service_description: Provides education support for youth with disabilities and special needs. Assessment and special education services are generally accessed through the assigned public school.
site_details: Call for information about special education services.
site_eligibility: Living in Crawfordsville, North Montgomery or South Montgomery School Districts -- Ages 3-22 -- With any form of disability that requires special education services (determined by assessment)

agency_desc: Government agency that locates, identifies, and appraises all taxable property in Montgomery County.
service_description: Calculates the value of all taxable property in Montgomery County which is then used to assess taxes. Hears appeals of assessments, oversees reassessments, and maintains information on boundaries and ownership.
site_details: Call or visit the website for more information.
site_eligibility: Varies by service; limited to taxable property in Montgomery County

agency_desc: Provides governance and municipal services for the city of Crawfordsville in Montgomery County.
service_description: Provides governance and municipal services for the city of Crawfordsville in Montgomery County. Responds to questions, complaints, and requests regarding town government and services.
nameLevel3: Land Use Planning and Regulation Services
site_details: Call or walk in during office hours for information.
site_eligibility: Open; serves the city of Crawfordsville in Montgomery County
Varies by service; services limited to properties within Crawfordsville city limits and a two mile jurisdiction.

agency_desc: Provides governance and municipal services for the city of Crawfordsville in Montgomery County.
service_description: Provides street and sidewalk maintenance, storm-sewer maintenance, snow and ice control, dead animal pick-up, street-sign maintenance, and groundskeeping of public properties in the city of Crawfordsville in Montgomery County. This department also oversees trash pick-up and residential and yard waste recycling for the city of Crawfordsville. Large item pick-up is available monthly for a fee.
site_details: Call for information, to submit a request, or make a report. Trash stickers are available to purchase at the Street Department office, Mayor's office, and local grocery stores.
site_eligibility: Serves the city of Crawfordsville in Montgomery County

agency_desc: Provides governance and municipal services for the city of Crawfordsville in Montgomery County.
site_name: MILLIGAN PARK, POOL, AND SPLASH PAD
service_name: MILLIGAN PARK, POOL, AND SPLASH PAD
service_description: Offers a public park for community sports and recreation, leisure activities, and nature conservation. Amenities include an outdoor pool and spray grounds.
site_details: Walk in to visit the parks; call or visit the website for information.

site_schedule.name: City/County Parks
site_schedule.schedule: Parks: Daily dawn to dusk, unless otherwise noted -- Splash Pad open daily 9am-9pm on a seasonal basis; Pool open Mon, Tues, Thurs, Fri, Sat, and Sun noon-6pm; Wed noon-8pm on a seasonal basis

site_schedule.name: Spray Grounds
site_schedule.schedule: Parks: Daily dawn to dusk, unless otherwise noted -- Splash Pad open daily 9am-9pm on a seasonal basis; Pool open Mon, Tues, Thurs, Fri, Sat, and Sun noon-6pm; Wed noon-8pm on a seasonal basis

site_eligibility: Parks are open to all; some programs may have specific requirements

agency_desc: Provides governance and municipal services for the city of Crawfordsville in Montgomery County.
service_description: Offers a recreational facility with programs for all ages, including team sports, weight room, gymnasium, game room, health and fitness classes, low-impact aerobics, and youth day camps.
site_details: Call, walk in or visit website for more information or to register.
site_eligibility: Open; individuals living in Crawfordsville receive discounts on fees

agency_desc: Provides law enforcement, crime investigation, crime prevention, emergency assistance, and other police duties for the city of Crawfordsville in Montgomery County.
service_description: Provides law enforcement, crime investigation, crime prevention, emergency assistance, and other police duties for the city of Crawfordsville in Montgomery County. Persons in need of emergency police assistance should call 9-1-1.
site_details: Call 9-1-1 for emergency assistance. For nonemergency services, call the office during business hours or call Montgomery County dispatch after hours.
site_eligibility: Open; serves the city of Crawfordsville in Montgomery County

agency_desc: Provides maintenance services on public roads and streets.
service_description: Maintains county roadways in Montgomery County, including patching, paving, snow removal, street sweeping, roadside mowing, and drainage along roadways.
site_details: Call for information or to report a problem.
site_eligibility: Open (limited to county roads and properties in Montgomery County)

agency_desc: County veterans service officers are veterans employed by the county to act as liaisons with county residents for veteran issues, including but not limited to; providing forms, information, and assistance in obtaining state and federal veterans benefits.
service_description: Provides information about and assistance with veterans' benefits to veterans, their surviving spouses, and their children. County service officers can assist in the completion and submission of forms necessary to receive all appropriate federal and state veterans' benefits.
site_details: Call for information or to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Veteran, surviving spouses or children of a veteran

agency_desc: Provides community outreach including medical and dental services to low-income, uninsured persons living in Montgomery County.
service_description: Provides a full range of dental services to adults and children. Services include cleanings, fillings, extractions, and X-rays. Provides referrals for additional dental services.

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that offers a variety of youth-centered programs.
service_description: Provides a one-on-one mentoring program to children living in Montgomery County. Adult mentors are matched with youth (ages 6-14) who have shared interests and goals. Mentors volunteer one to two hours per week for at least one year.
site_details: Call for volunteer or youth enrollment information.

site_schedule.name: Mentoring Programs
site_schedule.schedule: Office: Mon-Fri 9am-noon and 1pm-5pm -- Services are provided weekends, evenings, and out-of-school times.

site_eligibility: Adult Mentors: Ages 21 or older -- Able to pass criminal and Child Protective Services background checks -- Able to commit to the time involved for training and service -- Youth Participants: Ages 6-14 years-old at time of enrollment (matched participants may stay in program up to age 18)
Montgomery County schools and organizations
Girls -- Grades 6-12
Montgomery County groups or organizations that actively engage school-age youth in solving community problems

agency_desc: Provides limited financial assistance to persons in need living in Montgomery County.
service_description: Provides limited financial assistance for gas and electric bills (if at risk of disconnection), rent, and non-narcotic prescriptions. Assistance is based on funding and is distributed on a first-come, first-served basis.
site_details: Call schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: For Utility Assistance: Bill on disconnect notice -- Financial need -- Not received assistance within the past six months -- For Rent or Prescription Assistance: Financial need -- Not received assistance within the past six months

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization providing community outreach services, including a food, clothing, and furniture pantry.
service_description: Provides perishable and nonperishable food, gently used clothing (infant through adult sizes), shoes, coats, furniture, household items, cookware, dishes, linens, medical equipment (canes, walkers, etc.), and adult incontinent/diaper supplies to those in need. Item availability based on donations.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment; leave voicemail with name, phone number, and type of need requested.

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides transitional housing for women with or without children in need that are living or working in Montgomery County.
service_description: Provides transitional housing for women with or without children in need that are living or working in Montgomery County. Residents receive supportive services, including case management, budgeting instruction, and job search assistance.
site_details: Call for information or to schedule initial interview.
site_eligibility: Women, with or without children -- Able to work or currently have a source of income -- No violent or sex offenses -- Drug and alcohol free

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that offers information on abortion alternatives, provides support for pregnant women and new mothers, and offers free pregnancy testing.

agency_name: UNITED STATES DEPARTMENT OF AGRICULTURE RURAL DEVELOPMENT - INDIANA
agency_desc: A federal government agency responsible for issues related development and revitalization in rural Indiana by financing home buyers and rehabilitation projects.
service_name: SINGLE FAMILY HOUSING HOME REPAIR LOANS - CRAWFORDSVILLE AREA OFFICE
service_description: Offers loans to eligible applicants to purchase homes in eligible rural areas.  Offers a loan to eligible rural homeowners for modifications needed to make their home accessible or remove health and safety hazards. Maximum loan amount is $20,000, with a 1% interest rate. There is a $10,000 lifetime limit on grant funds for eligible seniors, 62 and older,. Grant recipients must repay if home is sold during first three years.
site_details: Call for information or to receive application.
site_eligibility: Living in eligible rural area in Boone, Fountain, Hamilton, Hendricks, Montgomery, Parke, Putnam, Tippecanoe, and Vermillion County -- US Citizen or permanent resident

Living in eligible rural area in Boone, Fountain, Hamilton, Hendricks, Montgomery, Parke, Putnam, Tippecanoe, and Vermillion County -- US Citizen or permanent resident -- Own and occupy home -- Low income (limits vary by county) -- Satisfactory credit story

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides caring and compassionate bereavement support services to families.
service_description: Offers typical bereavement support groups for children age 3 and up, youth, and adults. Special needs bereavement support groups as also offered; such as for suicide loss or loss of a child. Most groups require preregistration and are offered periodically as there is demand.
taxonomy_name: General Bereavement and Grief Support Groups

agency_desc: A faith-based nonprofit providing outreach services, including a thrift store.
service_description: Offers gently used clothing, shoes, coats, kitchenware, small kitchen appliances, furniture, linens, towels, seasonal items, and home decor at a discounted rate. Item availability is based on donations. Proceeds support Trinity Mission programs.
site_details: Walk in.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A commerical emergency and non-emergency stretcher transportation service that provides transportation in Central Indiana.
service_description: Provides stretcher transportation for seniors and persons with disabilities within Central Indiana. Provides transportation to Medicaid recipients for medical appointments within the same counties. Special bariatric cots (up to 29-inch width) available upon request. Scheduled personal care attendants ride free.  All rides are by advance reservation.
site_details: Call to schedule transportation at least 24 hours in advance. -- Callers with Traditional Medicaid: Call or visit Southeastrans member portal to schedule an appointment at least 2 days in advance. Be prepared to provide participant's Medicaid number, phone number, full name, date of birth, pick-up address, doctor or facility name and address, doctor's phone number, appointment date and time, and any special transportation needs.
site_eligibility: Individuals who are unable to travel independently --Signed physician statement requesting stretcher transportation -- Medicaid eligible residents who have Traditional Medicaid

agency_desc: A community mental health agency providing mental health and addiction services at locations in Hendricks and surrounding counties.
service_description: Provides a full range of outpatient mental health services, including assessment and evaluation; psychotherapy; individual, family, and group therapy; and addiction treatment. Case management, supported employment services and referrals are available to eligible clients receiving treatment from this center. School-based services available at some locations. Semi-independent living assistance and vocational rehabilitation services available for adult patients within the Cummins Community Reintegration Program.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call to schedule an assessment.
site_eligibility: Age 5 and older
Living in Boone, Hendricks, Marion, Montgomery, Morgan or Putnam county
Age 18 or older

agency_desc: A full-service nonprofit hospital providing emergency room care and comprehensive health care services.
service_description: Provides obstetrics/gynecology (OB/GYN) care for women. Services include yearly pelvic exams, pre- and post-natal care, breast care, menopausal care and more. Sliding-scale fees are available to those who qualify, including presumptive eligibility enrollment for Medicaid.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Pregnant women or parents with children
